ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problems following links with quotes?
ygData.msgSnippet: Pardon me.  I did not see your subsequent posting to the list where you talk about entity encodings and ExtractorHTML. So, yeah, the ExtractorHTML should

Pardon me.  I did not see your subsequent posting to the list where you 
talk about entity encodings and ExtractorHTML.

So, yeah, the ExtractorHTML should probably do an entity decoding on any 
links found in a page.   We should probably do it here rather than as 
part of the general fixup code we apply to every URL found because this 
seems to be how browsers work (If you get info for a page, it lists page 
links with the entity encoding undone.  If you put an entity encoding 
into the location bar, it makes request without undoing entity 
encoding).  I made an issue here: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1517693&group_id=73833&atid=539099

(FYI: You can see the links that Heritrix finds in a page by running the 
$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/htmlextractor tool.  Pass it URL of page).

Thanks,
St.Ack


Will Sargent wrote:
>
> Michael Stack wrote:
> > The link-to-crawl looks like 
> "http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff>"
> > in the hosting page?
> >
> > This should just pass through Heritrix untouched and result in a 
> request
> > out to http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff> (I haven't tried it. I'm
> > just looking at code).
> >
> > Have you verified with a browser there is a page at
> > http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff? 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff?>
> >
> > Are you looking at the logs on disk or via the UI? Which log? I'm
> > having trouble figuring how http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff>
> > <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person%27s-stuff>> becomes
> > http://foo.org/testing/person& <http://foo.org/testing/person&> 
> <http://foo.org/testing/person& <http://foo.org/testing/person&>>
> >
> It was using numeric character entities, so the quote was really '
> in the HTML page.
>
> Will.
>
>
